abstract: Seth MacFarlane, creator of the “Family Guy,” is teaming up with Google and Burger King to animate both an online series and ads to go with it.
snippet: Seth MacFarlane, creator of the “Family Guy,” is teaming up with Google and Burger King to animate both an online series and ads to go with it.
lead_paragraph: The creative types whose minds give birth to television shows and movies typically disdain the overt blending of advertising messages with their work. But Burger King found one who doesn’t seem to mind. In fact, he even agreed to create the ads.

headline.main: Serving 3 Brands: Burger King, Google and Seth MacFarlane
headline.print_headline: Serving 3 Brands: Burger King, Google and Seth MacFarlane

abstract: People are far more tolerant of ads when they accompany professionally created content than when they come with homemade video, according to a new survey.
snippet: People are far more tolerant of ads when they accompany professionally created content than when they come with homemade video, according to a new survey.
lead_paragraph: What kind of online videos are people willing to sit through ads for? The question is particularly urgent for companies like YouTube that have vast troves of videos but, for the most part, few ways to squeeze money out of them.

headline.main: Web Videos Where Ads Are Acceptable
headline.print_headline: Web Videos Where Ads Are Acceptable
